image.altText: A smiling woman holds a mobile phone in her right hand with the Ambient Menu web app open.

props.synopsis: Have you ever struggled to hear a conversation over the din of a lively restaurant? For people with hearing loss, socialising in loud restaurants creates significant challenges — but an Adelaide audiologist hopes her app will help match people with acoustically-friendly venues.

title.children: SA app helps people find conversation-friendly restaurants

image.altText: A painting of an 1850s ship.

props.synopsis: In a time well before instant communication in 1859, it took days for word of the Admella shipwreck to reach authorities, during which survivors were stranded with no food and water.

title.children: How a standard sailing trip from Adelaide to Melbourne become SA's worst maritime disaster

image.altText: Jack Robinson

props.synopsis: Australia's Jack Robinson has won a silver medal in the men's surfing, after Teahupo'o local Kauli Vaast won gold for France.

title.children: Australia's Jack Robinson claims silver medal in men's surfing at Paris Olympics

image.altText: ASX 200 board

props.synopsis: The global sell-off has continued on financial markets overnight amid mounting fears of a worldwide recession. Meanwhile, the ASX is trading higher ahead of the RBA's latest decision on interest rates later today. Follow live.

title.children: ASX higher after Magnificent Seven lose $US800b in value as recession fears stoke Wall Street sell-off

image.altText: A composite image of close-up shots of Senator Linda Reynolds and Brittany Higgins side by side.

props.synopsis: We've heard now from both sides represented in the high-stakes defamation trial between Linda Reynolds and Brittany Higgins. Neither have shown any sign of pulling punches.

title.children: From personal insults to private text messages, the first days of the Reynolds vs Higgins defamation trial show it's going to get ugly

image.altText: A woman in a veil walks past armed men carrying bayonets

props.synopsis: As she flew to neighbouring India, thousands of protesters stormed Sheikh Hasina's official residence, some lying on a bed, another munching on chicken leg pieces and others trying on her clothes. Here's how the longest-serving female head of state was toppled.

title.children: Bangladesh's 'Iron Lady', the longest-serving female head of government in the world, just fled on a chopper

image.altText: Jess Fox hugs Noemie Fox's face from in the water

props.synopsis: Fox sisters sweep the canoe slalom medals in Vaires-sur-Marne, with Noémie stepping out of Jess's enormous shadow to claim a joyful gold medal.

title.children: Jess Fox leapt into the water to salute her sister Noémie, so often in the shadow, now with a golden lustre all of her own

image.altText: Dustin Martin pumps his fist and yells in delight

props.synopsis: Brownlow medallist and three-time Norm Smith medallist Dustin Martin has announced his retirement from the AFL with immediate effect.

title.children: Tigers bombshell as club legend Dustin Martin announces retirement with 'immediate effect'

image.altText: On a purple background a woman in greyscale wears a read helmet and boxing gloves. Beside her a figure in red and 1 in blue box

props.synopsis: What started as athletes attempting to compete in their chosen sport has spiralled into a story that now involves a Russia-linked official, a global social media pile-on, huge amounts of mis- and disinformation and anti-trans activists jumping in.

title.children: What's behind a global social media pile-on in Olympic women's boxing

image.altText: RBA reno 2

props.synopsis: What a difference a week can make. Just days ago, there were growing calls for the RBA to hike rates once more. Now that's effectively off the table, financial markets are in a mad panic that rate cuts won't come soon enough.

title.children: The RBA has managed to dodge a bullet on interest rates, but dark economic clouds are looming

image.altText: Elizabeth Magistrates court

props.synopsis: The Elizabeth Magistrates Court hears a man accused of snatching a baby from a pram on a bus in Adelaide's north tightened his grip on the one-year-old when the mother tried to take her child back.

title.children: Adelaide man who allegedly snatched 1yo from pram faces court

image.altText: A man walking with his hands in his pockets.

props.synopsis: Jagmeet Singh, who pleaded guilty to causing death by dangerous driving after hitting grandfather Nengguang Wen at a crossing in Adelaide's south last year, is sentenced to three years and four months' home detention.

title.children: Truck driver who struck grandfather placed 'convenience' over safety of others, court hears

image.altText: A young man in a white shirt walks through sliding glass doors surrounded by people

props.synopsis: A man who walked free from the Supreme Court last month for helping his father cover up an alleged murder may have to return to prison after the Director of Public Prosecutions launched an appeal.

title.children: DPP launches appeal against decision to release man who assisted father in alleged murder

image.altText: An aerial shot of the Al-Assad airbase.

props.synopsis: Two Katyusha rockets are fired at Iraq's al-Asad air base, injuring US personnel as tensions rise in the Middle East.

title.children: Rockets fired at Iraq's al-Asad air base, injuring US personnel

image.altText: Armand Duplantis points to the crowd in celebration

props.synopsis: How do you compete at the Olympics when you know gold is an impossibility? That's what faced Kurtis Marschall in the men's pole vault final, against the incredible Mondo Duplantis — arguably the most dominant athlete alive.

title.children: In one of the great Olympic moments, Duplantis raises his own bar and touches the sky to create sporting history

image.altText: White rectangular, concrete building with glass windows and brown glass entrance way and blue sky.

props.synopsis: ASIO director-general Mike Burgess says the most likely terrorist attack in 2024 would involve a "lone actor", usually a young male who has been radicalised quickly online.

title.children: ASIO 'stretched' as it faces terror threat that is more complex than a decade ago

image.altText: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy speaking into a microphone in front of a crowd and looking emotional.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police Commissioner Michael Murphy has quit the NT Police Association following its criticism of his apology to Indigenous people for a history of "injustices".

title.children: NT police commissioner quits union following its criticism of his apology to Indigenous people

image.altText: tom pritcard army

props.synopsis: He was the last direct link with the 14,000 Australian servicemen who held the Libyan port of Tobruk against the German Africa Corps in 1941, a vital battle for the Allied forces.

title.children: Australia's last Rat of Tobruk Tom Pritchard dies aged 102

image.altText: A bald man wearing a black shirt holds a surfboard in the front yard of a brick house.

props.synopsis: The number of homes resold in less than three years has jumped to its highest level in at least a decade, according to figures from CoreLogic. It could be indicative of more borrowers choosing to sell their homes before falling too far behind on their repayments.

title.children: After too many late nights worried about his mortgage, Andy chose to sell up and rent instead

image.altText: View of a palm tree-lined road with a yellow middle strip in California leading into the horizon.

props.synopsis: California, known for palm tree-lined boulevards and the iconic Hollywood hills, is adding another claim to fame: renewable energy. And the Golden State could offer a glimpse into the crystal ball of Australia's energy future.

title.children: In California, big batteries are eating into gas demand, showing how Australia could harness its solar power glut

image.altText: a crocodile in murky water

props.synopsis: The remains are believed to be the 40-year-old NSW man who disappeared after falling into the Annan River on Saturday.

title.children: Human remains found in crocodile in Far North Queensland

image.altText: GPS tracker on an ankle with person wearing a black shoe.

props.synopsis: In a case largely of its own making, the High Court will today be asked to rule on whether a law requiring those freed from indefinite immigration detention last year to wear ankle bracelets and live under a curfew, is valid.

title.children: High Court to rule on legality of curfew and ankle bracelets for those freed from indefinite immigration detention

image.altText: The colourful Google logo against a white wall.

props.synopsis: A US judge says "Google is a monopolist" that pays billions to keep competitors off smartphones and browsers.

title.children: Google broke law with monopoly on search, court rules

image.altText: Silhouettes of people walking past a shopping centre in Pitt Street Mall, Sydney NSW

props.synopsis: NSW state government workers have been told working from home will be less common after a new directive from the premier's department nudged people back into the office.

title.children: Largest workforce in country told to return to office in memo from NSW premier's department

image.altText: Childlessness composite thumb

props.synopsis: Women around the world have taken to social media to protest comments by the Republican vice-presidential nominee.

title.children: 'Childless cat ladies unite': Women rail against US VP nominee JD Vance's comments on childfree women

image.altText: Penny Wong speaks at a podium in front of Australian and US flags.

props.synopsis: Australians will soon be eligible for easier passage through American airports as participation in the US Global Entry program is set to begin early next year.

title.children: Australia, US strike deal to save travellers time at American airports

image.altText: A man in military fatigues holds a photo of a man

props.synopsis: Police say the pilot was killed when separatist rebels rounded up those on board the helicopter when it landed in an isolated area.

title.children: NZ helicopter pilot killed in Indonesia's Papua region named as Glen Malcolm Conning

image.altText: A man in a suit stands in front of a flag.

props.synopsis: The head of ASIO says the targeting of Australia's youth and the rise of a violent mix of ideologies that defy logic are among the major reasons Australia's terror threat has been raised.

title.children: Young Australians falling down a 'rabbit hole of hate', ASIO boss warns

image.altText: Nick looking at son

props.synopsis: A proposal for a tiered approach to NDIS provider registration based on risk has been cautiously welcomed by a number of disability advocates.

title.children: We have a blueprint — now attention turns to the next phase of these contentious NDIS changes

image.altText: A close up of a man's face

props.synopsis: After intense rainfall in Kerala's hilly district, torrents of mud and rocks swept people to their deaths as they slept. Sahir Edathodi lost 25 family members in the disaster.

title.children: More than half a metre of rain fell on Kerala in 48 hours. Then, 86,000 square metres of land shifted

image.altText: Nina Kennedy smiles at the camera after the pole vault at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Nina Kennedy reaches the Paris Olympics pole vault final after a chaotic qualifying round that left two British stars in tears. Meanwhile, Matt Denny powers into the discus final and teenager Torrie Lewis wins at the Olympics for the first time.

title.children: 'You have to respect the process': Nina Kennedy shrugs off fellow world champion's qualifying blunder

image.altText: A man in glasses and a warm jacket takes a selfie with trees in the background

props.synopsis: A former Chinese spy is set to give evidence in a major Canadian inquiry into foreign interference following his appearance on Four Corners, where he revealed China's illegal operations on foreign soil, including the targeting of a prominent dissident who died in Canada in 2022.

title.children: Calls to reopen investigation into death of Chinese dissident

image.altText: The symbol of the United Nations on a building

props.synopsis: The United Nations has fired nine staff members from its agency for Palestinian refugees, after an internal investigation found they "may have" been involved in the October 7 attacks.

title.children: UN says nine employees 'may have' been involved in October 7

image.altText: Medium shot of men in uniform

props.synopsis: Embattled airlines aren’t new for regional Australia, but an aviation pioneer says it is possible to service remote communities without going bust.

title.children: Plenty of domestic operators have gone under before Rex. Are all regional airlines doomed?
